alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 5:33AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, McDowell, southeastern Kanawha, southern Webster, Wyoming, west central Pocahontas, Nicholas, southeastern Mingo, Raleigh, southeastern Logan, southwestern Clay, Fayette and southeastern Boone Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 533 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Glen to near Clintwood. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Summersville, Fayetteville, Welch, Richwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, Davenport, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Mullens, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Ansted, Oceana, Sophia, Gary and War. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 31 and 75. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 136. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
